template_info.description: Module 5: Planning for Profit and Cost Control — quiz generated from provided notes
template_info.instructions: Replace or extend questions as needed. Ensure all required fields are present.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the three levels of planning?
questions.explanation: The three levels are strategic planning (long-term), master budget (short-term objectives), and capital budgeting (intermediate-range investment decisions).

questions.question: A {blank} is a detailed plan, expressed in quantitative terms, that specifies how an organization will acquire and use resources during a particular period of time.
questions.explanation: A budget quantifies the plan for acquiring and using resources over a defined period.

questions.question: Which statement best describes a budgeting system?
options: It is the annual financial statements published to shareholders.
It is the procedures used to develop a budget.
It is the tax planning process required by law.
It is a forecast of stock prices.
questions.correct_answer: It is the procedures used to develop a budget.
questions.explanation: A budgeting system is the set of procedures used to develop a budget.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key purpose of budgeting systems?
questions.explanation: Key purposes include planning, communication/coordination, allocating resources, evaluating performance/providing incentives, and managing performance.

questions.question: The cash budget typically includes four major sections. Which option lists them correctly?
options: Beginning cash balance; Cash receipts; Cash disbursements; Financing; Ending cash balance
Operating income; Investing income; Financing income; Net cash
questions.correct_answer: Beginning cash balance; Cash receipts; Cash disbursements; Financing; Ending cash balance
questions.explanation: The cash budget sections are beginning cash balance, cash receipts, cash disbursements, cash needed from or used for financing, and ending cash balance.

questions.explanation: Budgetary slack (padding) can distort performance evaluation and resource allocation.

questions.question: Budgets created with the active participation of all affected employees are generally more effective than top‑down budgets. This approach is called:
questions.explanation: Participative budgeting fosters ownership, realism, and buy-in.

questions.question: Once the budgeting exercise is complete, you should be able to construct pro forma {blank}, a pro forma income statement, and a pro forma cash flow statement.
questions.explanation: The three primary pro forma statements are the balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement.
